page.title: 13Tourism - Local History
page.content: Where Toad Lane Museum stands is the site of the world's first successful co-op. The building opened in 1790 as a warehouse but on the 21st December 1844, the Rochdale Equitable Pioneers Society opened it as a co-operative store. It sold goods cheaper than local shops eg. sugar, flour, butter etc. It is now open as a museum and depicts how the shop used to be. The museum has been restored to a 19th Century setting. Sparrow Hill Museum is a listed building (1725) and was first used as a vicarage for St Chad's Church. It houses local artefacts. Also, several rooms recreate life in the past eg. a Victorian child's bedroom; a Clogging shop; a 19th Century pub.
